resources.string: The instructions will be written here, with a link to the video.
The goal of Tile Tilt is to remove all of the game tiles from the game board in as few removes as possible.

The pattern at the bottom of the screen represents the order tiles need to be selected from the play area. For example, if the tile sequence is as shown below, you would have to select tiles in the order Red,Green,Blue. (From white to black)

To select your first tile, tap it on the screen. It is marked with a white ball. Add adjacent tiles by tapping on them, or dragging your finger to change the shape of the sequence. The end of the sequence is marked with a black ball.
When you have selected a sequence that matches the given pattern, tap the white ball to remove the tiles from the screen. If the tiles match the sequence, they will be removed.
Sequences can contain three OR MORE tiles, as long as they follow the given pattern.
If the tiles do not match, the selected sequence will be reset. You can also clear a sequence by touching on an empty space.
To move the tiles around on the screen, tip it in the direction you want them to fall. The tiles will fall faster if the angle is increased.
Press the reset button to restart the stage. The tile configuration remains the same, but the pattern colors may change.
Black Hole Tiles are immune to the effects of gravity, and remain stationary when the board is tilted.
Rocket tiles blast off in the direction they are pointing and eliminate all other tiles in their way until reaching the end of the play area or a black hole tile.
Supernova Tiles explode and remove all adjacent tiles from the play area.
The game is best played laid flat initially. Try to remove long chains of tiles to earn 3 star ratings for each level.
